{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager - CIV",
  "description": "Reckitt Benckiser is the world&#39;s leading consumer health and hygiene company. Every day, across 60 countries, we work with the best people to challenge conventional thinking and strive to find even better ways to give people innovative solutions for healthier lives and happier homes.

We trust people in what they do and we give full accountability and autonomy to make things happen. That&rsquo;s how we generate the game-changing ideas that built 19 iconic Powerbrands around the world, such as Nurofen, Strepsils, Mucinex, Dettol, Lysol, Finish and Vanish.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;?Business Development Manager - CIV

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Lagos Island,&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	Embark on a dynamic sales journey with Reckitt as a Business Development Manager.
	The Business Development Manager is responsible for delivering stretch sales and shipment targets, coverage and in &ndash; store presence (Distribution, Shelving, Pricing and Merchandising) across channels in the locations.
	The role is also responsible for bringing all Reckitt&rsquo;s trade initiatives to the live locations.


Your Responsibilities


	Responsible for ensuring key performance indicators (Sales, shipments, ECOs, MSL etc) are met in the assigned territory.
	Collaborates with distributors (DB) and Reckitt HQ team to deliver expectations and innovations.
	Evaluate at regular intervals, the service rendered, coverage and distributors and super stockists and take corrective actions if and is required to ensure the business is healthy.
	Monitor constantly Distributor stock, sales, and trade receivables of distributors and super stockists and take corrective actions if and as required, to ensure the business is healthy.
	Responsible for identifying and developing new business opportunities. This involves analysing hard data and extensive field visit.
	Ensure proper planning of area coverage plans and the implementation of systematic coverage of the territory and evaluate and modify the same at regular intervals.
	Responsible monitoring and reporting competitive activities happening within his locations in line with Reckitt&rsquo;s policies and also access the activities&rsquo; possible impact on our business.
	Forecast brand wise / SKU wise sales within accuracy norms a month on month to ensure optimum stocks at the DB locations.
	Responsible for training his location(s) Distributor&rsquo;s Sales Teams on all sales fundamentals and requisite selling skills needed to win in trade.
	Responsible for ensuring the veracity of all data shared by the Distributors with Reckitt for his location(s).
	Responsible for ensuring proper verification of claims as per Reckitt&rsquo;s policies.
	Develop a growth strategy focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction
	Conduct research to identify new markets and customer needs
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients and stakeholders.
	Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to develop and implement strategic sales plans.
	Work closely with the business head, supply chain and the distributor teams to create processes between Reckitt and the distributors that are simple, robust and efficient facilitating unrestricted flow of necessary information on ordering, shipments and sales.


The experience we&#39;re looking for


	Minimum of BSc. or HND in relevant fields.
	Proven work experience as a business development manager, sales executive or a similar role
	Good overall understanding of sales and distribution
	Relevant experience in FMCG, preferably in international markets

Business Development Manager - CIV Job at Reckitt Benckiser




        
    

        
        Reckitt Benckiser is the world's leading consumer health and hygiene company. Every day, across 60 countries, we work with the best people to challenge conventional thinking and strive to find even better ways to give people innovative solutions for healthier lives and happier homes.

We trust people in what they do and we give full accountability and autonomy to make things happen. That’s how we generate the game-changing ideas that built 19 iconic Powerbrands around the world, such as Nurofen, Strepsils, Mucinex, Dettol, Lysol, Finish and Vanish.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: ?Business Development Manager - CIV

Job Location:  Lagos Island, Lagos
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



About the Role


	Embark on a dynamic sales journey with Reckitt as a Business Development Manager.
	The Business Development Manager is responsible for delivering stretch sales and shipment targets, coverage and in – store presence (Distribution, Shelving, Pricing and Merchandising) across channels in the locations.
	The role is also responsible for bringing all Reckitt’s trade initiatives to the live locations.


Your Responsibilities


	Responsible for ensuring key performance indicators (Sales, shipments, ECOs, MSL etc) are met in the assigned territory.
	Collaborates with distributors (DB) and Reckitt HQ team to deliver expectations and innovations.
	Evaluate at regular intervals, the service rendered, coverage and distributors and super stockists and take corrective actions if and is required to ensure the business is healthy.
	Monitor constantly Distributor stock, sales, and trade receivables of distributors and super stockists and take corrective actions if and as required, to ensure the business is healthy.
	Responsible for identifying and developing new business opportunities. This involves analysing hard data and extensive field visit.
	Ensure proper planning of area coverage plans and the implementation of systematic coverage of the territory and evaluate and modify the same at regular intervals.
	Responsible monitoring and reporting competitive activities happening within his locations in line with Reckitt’s policies and also access the activities’ possible impact on our business.
	Forecast brand wise / SKU wise sales within accuracy norms a month on month to ensure optimum stocks at the DB locations.
	Responsible for training his location(s) Distributor’s Sales Teams on all sales fundamentals and requisite selling skills needed to win in trade.
	Responsible for ensuring the veracity of all data shared by the Distributors with Reckitt for his location(s).
	Responsible for ensuring proper verification of claims as per Reckitt’s policies.
	Develop a growth strategy focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction
	Conduct research to identify new markets and customer needs
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients and stakeholders.
	Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to develop and implement strategic sales plans.
	Work closely with the business head, supply chain and the distributor teams to create processes between Reckitt and the distributors that are simple, robust and efficient facilitating unrestricted flow of necessary information on ordering, shipments and sales.


The experience we're looking for


	Minimum of BSc. or HND in relevant fields.
	Proven work experience as a business development manager, sales executive or a similar role
	Good overall understanding of sales and distribution
	Relevant experience in FMCG, preferably in international markets
	Should have proven track record of building business in new territories
	Customer- oriented
	Proficiency in MS Office and SAP
	Proficiency in English and French
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Time management and planning skills
	Able to handle complexities
	Entrepreneurial mindset; ability to work independently, demonstrating initiative and innovation.
	Familiar with the Côte d'Ivoire geography and understands the trade dynamics.
	Assertive in taking actions/calls.
	Capable of operating autonomously as the sole Reckitt representative in the country, ensuring accountability and efficiency.


The skills for success:


	Negotiation skills, Excellent interpersonal skills, communication skill, stakeholder management, organised, entrepreneurial mindset and planning skills.
